publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-106 Cathie Craigie: Cumbernauld’s 50th Anniversary—That the Parliament congratulates Cumbernauld on its 50th anniversary; notes that the new town was established in 1957 as a population overspill for Glasgow; notes that Cumbernauld now boasts a population of approximately 52,000 people, making it the eighth largest town in Scotland; recognises the commitment of ordinary people who moved into this budding community, and thanks all individuals, groups and organisations who have fostered the strong community which exists in Cumbernauld today.

S3M-106 Cathie Craigie: Cumbernauld’s 50th Anniversary—That the Parliament congratulates Cumbernauld on its 50th anniversary; notes that the new town was established in 1957 as a population overspill for Glasgow; notes that Cumbernauld now boasts a population of approximately 52,000 people, making it the eighth largest town in Scotland; recognises the commitment of ordinary people who moved into this budding community, and thanks all individuals, groups and organisations who have fostered the strong community which exists in Cumbernauld today.
S3M-106 Cumbernauld’s 50th Anniversary (lodged on 31 May 2007) Hugh O’Donnell*, Pauline McNeill*, Marlyn Glen*, Bill Butler*, Elaine Smith*, Jackie Baillie*
S3M-106 Cumbernauld’s 50th Anniversary (lodged on 31 May 2007) Iain Gray*, Karen Gillon*, Margaret Mitchell*, Jamie Hepburn*, Michael McMahon*
S3M-106 Cumbernauld’s 50th Anniversary (lodged on 31 May 2007) Trish Godman*, Mary Mulligan*
S3M-106 Cumbernauld’s 50th Anniversary (lodged on 31 May 2007) Mr Frank McAveety*, Karen Whitefield*
S3M-106 Cumbernauld’s 50th Anniversary (lodged on 31 May 2007) Hugh Henry* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S3M-106 Cumbernauld’s 50th Anniversary (lodged on 31 May 2007) Cathy Peattie*
